ActFederal Courts Act
SubjectRules Amending the Federal Courts Rules (Limited-Scope Representation)
PrecisRules amending the FEDERAL COURTS RULES (LIMITED SCOPE REPRESENTATION) in order to (1) add an option for a party to be represented by a lawyer (a “solicitor”) on a defined, limited mandate (i.e. for only part of the Court proceeding); (2) increase the proportion of proceedings in the Federal Court of Appeal and the Federal Court in which litigants are represented by a lawyer, whether on a limited or unlimited basis; and (3) allow litigants to have a lawyer represent them for only part of a legal proceeding which will provide litigants with better access to justice while also making the Court process more efficient.
